SENT.plain: Weber's syndrome with vertical gaze palsy is rarely reported in literature
We present a case of a 47-year-old female who developed sudden onset of left exotropia, right sided hemiplegia and vertical gaze palsy
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed multiple infarcts involving both thalami and extending caudally into the midbrain
This case presents the diverse clinical picture following midbrain infarcts
